publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-4385 Robert Brown: RNIB Scotland Campaign of the Year—That the Parliament congratulates RNIB Scotland on winning the TFN Scottish Charity Awards Campaign of the Year Award; notes that its success was based on its campaign to secure a higher rate mobility component of the disability living allowance for those with severe sight loss; welcomes the fact that the award recognised both its innovative and participative style of campaigning; welcomes the major contribution made over the years by RNIB Scotland and other organisations fighting for the rights and needs of blind and visually impaired people, and urges the Scottish Government and other public agencies to continue to recognise the contribution that blind and visually impaired people of all ages can make to wider Scottish society.

S3M-4385 RNIB Scotland Campaign of the Year (lodged on 15 June 2009) Jamie Hepburn*, Robin Harper*, Ross Finnie*, Des McNulty*, Liam McArthur*, Elizabeth Smith*, Nanette Milne*, Cathy Jamieson*, Anne McLaughlin*, Dr Richard Simpson*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Bob Doris*, Jim Tolson*, Mike Pringle*, Kenneth Gibson*, Jackie Baillie*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Jackson Carlaw*, Sandra White*, Ken Macintosh*, Cathie Craigie*, Patrick Harvie*
S3M-4385 RNIB Scotland Campaign of the Year (lodged on 15 June 2009) Pauline McNeill*, James Kelly*, Hugh Henry*, Alison McInnes*
S3M-4385 RNIB Scotland Campaign of the Year (lodged on 15 June 2009) Gil Paterson*, Stuart McMillan*, Dave Thompson*

S3M-4385 Robert Brown: RNIB Scotland Campaign of the Year—That the Parliament congratulates RNIB Scotland on winning the TFN Scottish Charity Awards Campaign of the Year Award; notes that its success was based on its campaign to secure a higher rate mobility component of the disability living allowance for those with severe sight loss; welcomes the fact that the award recognised both its innovative and participative style of campaigning; welcomes the major contribution made over the years by RNIB Scotland and other organisations fighting for the rights and needs of blind and visually impaired people, and urges the Scottish Government and other public agencies to continue to recognise the contribution that blind and visually impaired people of all ages can make to wider Scottish society. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn, Robin Harper, Ross Finnie, Des McNulty, Liam McArthur, Elizabeth Smith, Nanette Milne, Cathy Jamieson, Anne McLaughlin, Dr Richard Simpson, Shirley-Anne Somerville, Bob Doris, Jim Tolson, Mike Pringle, Kenneth Gibson, Jackie Baillie, Joe FitzPatrick, Jackson Carlaw, Sandra White, Ken Macintosh, Cathie Craigie, Patrick Harvie, Pauline McNeill, James Kelly, Hugh Henry, Alison McInnes, Gil Paterson, Stuart McMillan, Dave Thompson
S3M-4385 RNIB Scotland Campaign of the Year (lodged on 15 June 2009) Lewis Macdonald*
S3M-4385 RNIB Scotland Campaign of the Year (lodged on 15 June 2009) Hugh O’Donnell*
S3M-4385 RNIB Scotland Campaign of the Year (lodged on 15 June 2009) Karen Whitefield*
S3M-4385 RNIB Scotland Campaign of the Year (lodged on 15 June 2009) Tom McCabe*
